text:
In collaboration with Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited, the Tamil Nadu Science and Technology Centre (TNSTC) is setting up a nuclear lab that is dedicated to the general public, at Birla Planetarium.

Lab to open next month

The lab will be thrown open for the public next month.

“The gallery will throw light on how nuclear energy is useful for society, especially generation of electricity. This reduces the amount of energy generated from fossil fuels.

Less use of fossil fuels means lowering greenhouse gas emissions; less fuel offers more energy,” Dr. P. Iyamperumal, Executive Director, Tamil Nadu Science and Technology Centre, said.

Costs Rs. 2.3 crore

The lab is being set up at a cost of Rs. 2.3 crore.

Earlier, TNSTC collaborated with Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and Defence Research Development Organisation (DRDO) in setting up a space gallery, throwing light on the development of space technology in India, and a DRDO pavilion showcasing the works undertaken by the Defence Research Development Organisation in more than its 50 laboratories across the nation in the field of aeronautics, armaments, electronics, and combat vehicles.
title: Nuclear lab to come up at Birla Planetarium
